intro: Phyllanthus klotzschianus var. brachycladus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to well-drained soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
